medical_history.chief_complaint: Mild bilateral lower extremity edema for approximately one week.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient has experienced recurrent post-activity chest pain and shortness of breath for more than 11 years. In 2010, he was first admitted due to these symptoms for half a year. Since then, symptoms progressed leading to a WHO-FC change from I to IV by July 2016, after which he experienced severe cough and hemoptysis due to a cold leading to pneumonia. Following hemoptysis, symptoms improved but cyanosis appeared. The patient was re-admitted in March 2021 due to the edema.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient was diagnosed with idiopathic pulmonary arterial hypertension (IPAH) in 2010. In July 2016, he experienced severe cough and hemoptysis due to a severe cold leading to pneumonia.
